abstract: Findings of Tara Oceans Project, consortium of 18 institutions which sent 110-foot schooner Tara on four-year research expedition of world's oceans, report marine microscopic life is profoundly affected by water temperature, concluding that climate change can upset ocean's ecosystem kept in balance by these microorganisms; findings appear in journal Science.
lead_paragraph: Researchers studied plankton from around the globe and uncovered vast genetic diversity and clues to how warming temperatures may affect ocean life.

headline.main: Scientists Sample the Ocean and Find Tiny Additions to the Tree of Life
headline.print_headline: Scientists Find Tiny Additions to the Tree of Life

snippet: Researchers studied plankton from around the globe and uncovered vast genetic diversity and clues to how warming temperatures may affect ocean life.
